description.narrative: The group will work to actively support the generation of environmentally knowledgeable and responsible citizens in the framework of food sovereignty. It will promote the participation of youth sectors in civil society and promote stronger critical and environmentally and socially just thinking among civil society representatives. Globalization has largely led to the development of consumerism, which is acculturating the society and producing conflicts between environmental and social needs. To support food sovereignty, the group will promote a culture of responsible choices and stronger connections between the farm and city. Specifically, the group will organize workshops for movement members around food sovereignty to strengthen organizational knowledge; work with partner organizations to promote responsible consumption through policy; generate support and raise awareness for the new policy and the new awareness of consumption habits throughout the public; and to produce communication materials, theater shows, art, organic food demonstrations, and reporting on the current situation.
